original: Liljestrand, Holger, civilingenjör, vägdirektör, Jönköping, f. 28/4/97 i Gbg av försäkr:dir. Peter Erik L. o. Tekla Carlberg. — Stud :ex. v. Sofi Almquists samsk. i Sthlm 15, avg:ex. fr. KTH 22, res:off:ex. 17. Fänr. i fortif. res. 17, und :löjtn. 20, löjtn. 25, i VVK 26, kapt. i VVK 33. Konstr. v. Bergsunds Mek. Verkst. A-B i Sthlm 23, arb:led. h. J. M. Hutchison Entrepr. i Pennsylvania, USA, arb:-led. o. bitr. arb :chef v. A-B Vägför-bättringar i Sthlm 25-32, tf. byråing. v. väg- o. vattenbyggn :styr. 32-35, byråing. å vägtrafikbyrån där 36, vägdir. i Jönköp. 1. sed. 43. Medl. av Sv. tek-n :för. 23-35.
translated: Liljestrand, Holger, civil engineer, road director, Jönköping, born April 28, 1897 in Gothenburg, son of insurance director Peter Erik L. and Tekla Carlberg. Completed studies at Sofi Almquist's coeducational school in Stockholm in 1915, graduated from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1922, completed reserve officer training in 1917. Became a second lieutenant in the fortification reserve in 1920, lieutenant in 1925, and joined the Road and Water Construction Corps in 1926. Promoted to captain in 1933. Engineering work at Bergsunds Mekaniska Verkstads AB in Stockholm in 1923, worked as a supervisor at J.M. Hutchison Entreprises in Pennsylvania, USA, and as assistant works manager at AB Vägförbättringar in Stockholm from 1925 to 1932. Temporary bureau engineer at the Road and Water Construction Board from 1932 to 1935, bureau engineer at the road traffic bureau in 1936, and road director in Jönköping since 1943. Member of the Swedish Technical Association from 1923 to 1935.

structured.name: Holger Liljestrand
structured.description: Civil engineer, road director in Jönköping
